articles.title: What happens if Russia turns off its gas to Europe? Here's who's most vulnerable - ABC News
articles.description: Russia halts gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria because they didn't pay for their gas in Russian currency. Now other European countries are worried they'll also get cut off if they don't pay in roubles.
articles.content: Moscow has stopped sending gas to Poland and Bulgaria for refusing to pay for their imported energy in roubles, which has some Russian-gas-reliant EU countries fearing they could loose their supplies… [+5224 chars]

articles.title: Poland says countries paying for Russian gas in roubles should be penalised - Reuters
articles.description: The European Union should penalise countries that use roubles to pay for Russian gas, Poland's climate minister said, following Moscow's decision to cut off supplies to Poland and Bulgaria over their refusal to do so.
